abilities.name: Add to Inkwell: Own Character
abilities.regex: /put chosen character of yours into your inkwell facedown and exerted/gi
abilities.explanation: Moves your card from the board into their inkwell.
abilities.justification: Opposite of adding an opponent's card to their inkwell

resource_dominance.explanation: Putting a card into the inkwell

board_control.explanation: Getting rid of your Character penalty

abilities.name: State: Can't Be Dealt Damage
abilities.explanation: Being able to not be dealt damage is very good. Only way to get around that is "moving" damage counters
abilities.justification: Only way to get around that is "moving" damage counters

lore_velocity.explanation: Not being damaged is a survivability factor

board_control.explanation: Really helps in challenges and keeping board control

abilities.name: State: Can't quest
abilities.regex: /(this character|they|he|she|it)? ?can't quest for the rest of this turn/gi
abilities.explanation: Not questing is a direct impact on lore gain
abilities.justification: This is a downside to powerful abilities

lore_velocity.explanation: Directly impacts ability to Gain Lore

abilities.name: Trigger: Card Under
abilities.regex: /Whenever you put a card under (this|one of your) ?(characters?)? (or)? ?(locations?)?/gi
abilities.explanation: Whenever you put a card under another card
abilities.justification: Adding Cards under another card might not be trivial to do

abilities.name: Keyword: Vanish
abilities.explanation:
When an opponent chooses this character
for an action, banish them.
abilities.justification: Vanish makes characters vulnerable

abilities.name: Boost
abilities.explanation: TBD
abilities.justification: TBD

abilities.name: State: Enters Play
abilities.explanation: Characters/items that enter exerted have an inherent disadvantage. Also entering with damage is on it's own detrimental.
abilities.justification: Entering play with damage or exerted should be a penalty

board_control.explanation: Entering exerted or having damage has a penalty

abilities.name: Card Effect: Put card under
abilities.regex: /put the top card of your deck facedown under (?:this|one of your) (?:characters?)? ?(?:or)? ?(?:locations?)? ?(with Boost)?/gi
abilities.explanation: Part of boost or boost related abilities
abilities.justification: You loose a card, but you could recover so it should be better than inking in terms of the penalty

resource_dominance.explanation: Less than filtering to the bottom of your deck as you can recover this card more easily

abilities.name: Condition: Card Under
abilities.explanation: This applies to effects such as shift or boost
abilities.justification: By itself this just lower the potential of the ability this affects triggering.

abilities.name: Keyword: Alert
abilities.explanation:
This character can challenge as if they
had Evasive
abilities.justification: Not as good as being evasive

abilities.name: State: Can't be challenged
abilities.explanation: This can be a powerful ability as it makes your characters robust to challenges
abilities.justification: Like being ready

abilities.name: Trigger: End of your turn
abilities.explanation: Fairly reliable.
abilities.justification: Trigger: End of your turn

abilities.name: Trigger: Opponent's Turn
abilities.explanation: During the play turn of your opponent
abilities.justification: Trigger: Opponent's Turn -> This is more restrictive as you have less control

abilities.name: Condition: Have in play
abilities.explanation: This is a condition on a lot of cards, I would say in terms of CTL it is a punishment as it's harder to accomplish than if it's just a normal ability.
abilities.justification: I will make this dependant on the cost of the card. The higher the cost, it's implied that the more time you will have had to set up this condition. So the less the penalty

abilities.name: Trigger: Play More Than
abilities.explanation: Very deck specific a condition that is harder to achieve the more cards you are required to play and the card type
abilities.justification: Trigger: Play More Than X Cards -> Lowers the trigger the more cards you need to play

abilities.name: Condition: Pay
abilities.explanation: Paying ink it does the opposite of cheating ink
abilities.justification: opposite of cheating ink

abilities.name: Keyword: Bodyguard
abilities.explanation: Bodyguard with characters with high willpower can be very disruptive
abilities.justification: Forces interaction of the character

abilities.name: Keyword: Reckless
abilities.explanation: Reckless can be seen as potentially bad

abilities.name: Keyword: Support
abilities.explanation: Support is offensive but leaves you exposed
abilities.justification: Give Strength to character at the cost of questing

board_control.explanation: (Support Multiplier * card strength ) - Leaving the character exerted ->

abilities.name: Trigger: Sing a Song
abilities.explanation: Singing songs
abilities.justification: Trigger: Sing a Song -> Singing songs can be done by any character

abilities.name: Keyword: Gain
abilities.explanation: Captures giving Keywords (Aura) to Other characters
abilities.justification: Giving keywords to own characters is mainly good, except for Reckless. However if it's the opposing characters that gain keywords that is bad, except for Reckless.

resource_dominance.explanation: Giving different keywords to characters can be beneficial

abilities.name: Base: High Strength
abilities.explanation: High strength allows board control easier than lower strength
abilities.justification: Mirrors the high Willpower

abilities.name: Card Effect: Opponent Discards Hand
abilities.regex: /(Each opponent|they|you may) discards?(?: all cards)?(?: in)? (their|your) hands?/gi
abilities.explanation: This is extremely disruptive if timed correctly
abilities.justification: Which turn the card can be played has a direct impact on how disruptive it can be.

abilities.name: Trigger: Draw Card
abilities.explanation: This is a common trigger and can be achieved easily if played correctly
abilities.justification: Trigger: Draw Card -> can be easy to achieve but requires setup

abilities.name: Trigger: Character Challenges
abilities.explanation: This is a condition that is easy to meet, but exposes the character and deals damage. so it's not a massive win
abilities.justification: Trigger: On of your Character Challenges -> Easy to trigger but downsides for the character that challenges

abilities.name: Condition: Opposing Character Exerted
abilities.regex: /if an opponent has an exerted character in play/gi
abilities.explanation: This is likely but can be played around
abilities.justification: This is likely but should essentially penalise other triggers like on play

abilities.name: Trigger: During Your Turn
abilities.explanation: This is a recurring trigger that can be activated at any point during your turn. It implies a high degree of control for the player but requires the character to survive until your turn begins.
abilities.justification: Trigger: During Your Turn -> Proactive and fully controllable by you.

abilities.name: Condition: Has No Damage or Not
abilities.explanation: Having or not having damage can be powerful as both when you play and with synergies of removal of damage.
abilities.justification: Having no damage is easy to trigger (x1.75), having damage should be a penalty multiplier (x0.5).

abilities.name: Trigger: Start/End Turn
abilities.explanation: This is a recurring trigger, but it also means that the card that has it has to survive at least until the next turn.
abilities.justification: Trigger: Start/End of Turn -> Requires surviving one turn if Start But if End of turn then it's almost like on play

abilities.name: Trigger: Remove Damage
abilities.explanation: Removing damage as a condition is specific
abilities.justification: Trigger: Remove Damage -> Should provide a penalizing as by itself it's a hard condition to satisfy without other cards

abilities.name: State: Ready Ink
abilities.explanation: Readying cards from your inkwell allows you to essentially "play for free"
abilities.justification:
This ability effectively doubles your available ink for a turn, which is an incredibly powerful tempo swing.

Comparison to Standard Ramp: We established that a one-time effect of putting a single card into your inkwell (Hand to Inkwell) is worth +2.5. This is because it provides a permanent +1 ink advantage for every subsequent turn.

Valuing the Tempo Swing: "Readying" all your ink is not a permanent ramp, but a massive, repeatable burst of temporary ramp. If you quest on turn 5 with 5 ink in your inkwell, this ability gives you 5 extra ink to use that turn. This allows you to play a 5-cost card for essentially free. We've established that "Play for Free" effects are valued by the cost of the card being cheated.

The Value Proposition: A repeatable ability to generate ~5 ink's worth of tempo each turn is arguably more powerful than a one-time permanent ramp effect. Assigning it a value of +4.0 places it higher than our standard ramp ability (+2.5), correctly identifying it as one of the most powerful resource-generating abilities in the game. It is balanced by the fact that it is an "On Quest" trigger, which is less reliable than an "On Play" trigger.

resource_dominance.explanation: More than Ramp effect (should be similar to play for Free)

abilities.name: Card Effect: Card from Inkwell to Hand
abilities.regex: /return (one|a|\d+) card(?:s)? (at random )?from your inkwell to your hand/gi
abilities.explanation: This is the reverse of our "Ramp" ability (Hand to Inkwell), which we valued at +2.5. The value is high because the effect is permanent and compounds over time.
abilities.justification:
Losing a ramped resource is, therefore, a permanent penalty of equal magnitude. Losing two such resources is a massive drawback.
Downside Value = -5.0 (2 * -2.5).

abilities.name: Play: Sing Together Song
abilities.explanation: Sing together allows more flexibility when singing as you can pool multiple characters to sing the song.
abilities.justification: It allows players to swarm the board with low-cost characters and still play high-impact songs, generating a massive tempo advantage that standard songs cannot match.

abilities.name: Card Effect: Bottom of Opponents deck
abilities.explanation: Putting a card at the bottom of opponents deck
abilities.justification: Putting a card at the bottom of opponents deck is almost like discarding

resource_dominance.explanation: opposite of putting it on the bottom of your deck

abilities.name: Bounce: Own Characters
abilities.explanation: Technically a bad tempo ability, but normally comes as part as a combined play.
abilities.justification: Returning cards to your hand is negative tempo

resource_dominance.explanation: You are getting a new resource

abilities.name: Type: Action
abilities.explanation: We treat this the same as having a charcter with an OnPlay Ability
abilities.justification: This ability will trigger reliably same as playing a character with that ability

abilities.name: State: Can't Challange
abilities.explanation: Narrow form of control
abilities.justification: Affects tempo - but characters can still quest

board_control.explanation: Affects tempo - but characters can still quest

abilities.name: Card Effect: Put into hand
abilities.regex: /(?:you may reveal an? (character|location|song|action|item) card and)? put (\d+|a|one|two|three|it)(?: card)?s? into your hand/gi
abilities.explanation: Same as draw if you are putting into hand
abilities.justification: Card draw is the primary engine for resource advantage. (Put into Hand)

resource_dominance.explanation: Draw (drawCount) * Card Type * Card Draw Value (2.0) * Triggers

abilities.name: Trigger: This Character Banishes
abilities.regex: /When(?:ever)? (this character|he|she|it) banishes another character in a challenge/gi
abilities.explanation: This abilitiy triggers on banishing another character in a challange
abilities.justification: Trigger: This Character Banishes -> conditional on actually banishing the character challenged

abilities.name: Trigger: Banished in a Challenge (Self)
abilities.regex: /When(?:ever)? (this character|he|she|it) is banished in a challenge/gi
abilities.explanation: This ability triggers when this character is banished as a result of a challenge, either as the challenger or the one being challenged.
abilities.justification: Trigger: Banished in a Challenge -> More conditional than a simple 'On Banish' or 'Leaves Play' trigger because it requires combat. Its reliability is lower than being banished by any means, but it provides value from an otherwise negative board state event.

abilities.name: Trigger: On Challenge Start
abilities.explanation: This ability triggers when this character initiates a challenge against another character, regardless of the outcome.
abilities.justification: Trigger: On Challenge Start -> This is better than needing to banish the opposing character.

abilities.name: Trigger: Play a Card Type
abilities.explanation: This ability triggers whenever you play a card of a 'specific' type.
abilities.justification: Trigger: You Play an Card Type -> Its reliability is conditional and therefore it should be a multiplier that reduces the reliability of whatever it's triggering

abilities.name: Keyword: Shift (Normal)
abilities.explanation: Shifting is a core mechanic that helps increase your RDS but penalises your BCR as it removes the character you shifted onto
abilities.justification: you get to play a large character for less ink than it's cost The penalty for Shift is now explicitly defined as 50% of the cost of self-banishing.

board_control.explanation: penalizing the lack of board development

abilities.name: Trigger: Leaves Play
abilities.explanation: This trigger is the biggest catch-all since it means: Going back to hand, being banished, getting put into your inkwell etc..
abilities.justification: Trigger: Leave Play -> Iron clad trigger that is on par to On Play Triggers as it is almost guaranteed

abilities.name: Condition: For Each
abilities.explanation: Condition that might stack up substantially
abilities.justification: This is the basis for cards that whole decks are built around, high risk high reward

abilities.name: Stat: Lore Buff
abilities.explanation: Characters Gain Lore buff as a result of this ability

abilities.name: Base: Lore Potential
abilities.explanation: Fundamental LVI score derived from a character's printed lore, modified by its survivability and safety.
abilities.justification: This is the core calculation for LVI. It's defined as an ability so its formula can use the context modifiers created by other keywords.

abilities.name: Base: Uninkable Burden
abilities.explanation: Applies a penalty to the RDS for cards that cannot be put into the inkwell.
abilities.justification:
Uninkable cards can lead to inconsistent starts. The penalty scales with the card's cost.

From data from all cards from set 1 to 9 the ink differential between inkable and uninkable vanilla cards oscillated around 1.75

abilities.name: Base: High Willpower
abilities.explanation: Grants a survivability bonus to characters with high willpower.
abilities.justification: Characters with 6 or more willpower are naturally harder to remove through damage.

abilities.name: Type: Item
abilities.explanation: Applies a survivability modifier to abilities on Item cards.
abilities.justification: Items are generally harder to interact with than characters, making their abilities more reliable.

abilities.name: State: Can't Exert
abilities.regex: /(all characters|characters|opponent's characters|other characters|opposing characters|chosen character) (?:can't|cannot) exert/gi
abilities.explanation: The value is slightly increased to create more separation from Can't Challenge. Preventing all forms of exertion (questing, singing, etc.) is significantly more powerful than just preventing challenges.
abilities.justification: Good for tempo as it blocks any abilities that would require exerting.

abilities.name: Trigger: On Banish (Other)
abilities.quick_description: other or your characters are banished
abilities.regex: /when(?:ever)? (?:a character of yours|one of your (?:other )?(?:\w+ )?characters|a(?:n other?) character) is banished ?(in a challenge)?/gi
abilities.explanation: Whenever other of your characters are banished
abilities.justification: Trigger: On Banish (Other) -> Banish 1.5 but if it's only in a challenge 1.15

abilities.name: Condition: Cards in Hand
abilities.explanation: This condition has a direct impact on resource dominance control as it does the opposite of generating resources. It looks for you to have no or a specific number of resources
abilities.justification: Having an empty hand or lower cards in hand is generally a bad position to be in. This will be offset by other abilities in the

resource_dominance.explanation: Having less hand is generally a bad position to be in. This will be offset by other abilities in the

abilities.name: Condition: Character exerted
abilities.regex: /(while|if|and) (?:this character|one of your characters|all of your characters) (is|are) exerted|⟳.+—/gi
abilities.explanation: Character has to be exerted
abilities.justification: Leaves your character unprotected to challenges - would be the same value as exerting an opposing character but in negative

board_control.explanation: Leaves your character unprotected to challenges

abilities.name: State: Can't play
abilities.quick_description: Can't play a type of card
abilities.explanation: Opponents are prevented from playing a specific type of card
abilities.justification: This affects the tempo of the game enormously

abilities.name: Lore: Gain
abilities.explanation: Directly increases the player's lore total by a specified amount.
abilities.justification: A fundamental way to win the game.

lore_velocity.explanation: Lore Gained based on mults and triggers ->

abilities.name: Lore: Lose
abilities.explanation: Causes one or more opponents to lose a specified amount of lore.
abilities.justification:
This slows down the opponent's victory progression.
The multiplier is slightly reduced to reflect the strategic principle that proactively advancing your own win condition (Gain) is superior to reactively slowing down your opponent's (Lose).

abilities.name: Card Effect: Draw
abilities.explanation: Allows the player to draw one or more cards from their deck.
abilities.justification: Card draw is the primary engine for resource advantage.

abilities.name: Card Effect: Opponent Discards
abilities.regex: /(chosen opponent|each opponent|player)? ?(chooses and|reveals their hand and)? ?discards? (\d+|a|one|two|three) ?(song|item|character|action|location)? ?cards? ?(at random)?/gi
abilities.explanation: Forces an opponent to discard one or more cards from their hand.
abilities.justification: Directly attacks the opponent's resources.

abilities.name: Card Effect: Self Discard
abilities.explanation: The player must discard one or more cards, usually as a cost.
abilities.justification: The penalty for discarding a card is now logically mirrored to the value of drawing a card, making the cost a -2.0 to RDS.

resource_dominance.explanation: opposite of drawing a card - discardAmount * -(@cardDrawValue)

abilities.name: Card Effect: Look at Deck
abilities.regex: /Look at the top (\d+|one|two|three|four|five)?(?: )?card(?:s?) of your deck/gi
abilities.explanation: Allows the player to look at the top cards of their deck to gain information and potentially organize them.
abilities.justification: Provides card selection and filters draws.

abilities.name: Card Effect: Tutor
abilities.explanation: A powerful form of card selection where a player looks at cards from their deck, puts them into their hand
abilities.justification: This is a direct tutor effect, guaranteeing the player gets a useful card. It is the single most effective way of getting the card you want.

resource_dominance.explanation: You get that exact card that you want

abilities.name: Card Effect: Filter to Top/Bottom
abilities.explanation: After looking at cards from the top of the deck, the player puts the unwanted cards on the bottom. (You lose a card, but with the slim theoretical possibility of getting it back after a shuffle, making it the least severe of the three major costs).
abilities.justification: Improves the quality of future draws.

resource_dominance.explanation: filtering to the bottom is bad but filtering to the top is good

abilities.name: Card Effect: Discard to Hand
abilities.regex: /return (a|another|an|up to \d+) (character|item|action|song|card) ?cards?(?: with (?:cost)? ?(\d+) (?:¤|⬡|⛉)? ?or (?:less|more))? ?from your discard ?(?:pile)? ?to your hand/gi
abilities.explanation: Allows a player to return a card from their discard pile to their hand.
abilities.justification: This is a form of card advantage, as it recovers a spent resource.

abilities.name: Card Effect: Discard to Deck
abilities.regex: (shuffle|put) (\d+|all|one|two|three|a|chosen)(?:.*?)? cards? from your discard (?:into|on the (top|bottom) of) your deck
abilities.explanation: Shuffles cards from the discard pile back into the deck.
abilities.justification: Prevents decking out and allows for reuse of key cards. Potentially doesn't do much

resource_dominance.explanation: Putting it at the top of deck is best, Shuffle does almost nothing, bottom is like banishing

abilities.name: Card Effect: Look at Opponent's Hand
abilities.regex: /(look at (chosen|each) opponent's hand|chosen opponent reveals their hand)/gi
abilities.explanation: The player gets to see the cards in an opponent's hand.
abilities.justification: Provides valuable information for strategic planning.

abilities.name: Card Effect: Hand to Inkwell
abilities.regex: /put (a|an additional|the top|any|chosen|one)(?: character| item | location| action| song| item or location)?(?: card)? (?:from your discard|from your hand|of your deck)?(?: )?into (your|its player's) inkwell( facedown)?( and exerted)?/gi
abilities.explanation: Allows a player to place a card into their inkwell, accelerating their ink resources.
abilities.justification:
Directly accelerates resources (ramp), which is a powerful effect.
25% better than just drawing a random card

abilities.name: Bounce: Opposing Character
abilities.regex: /Return chosen (?:opposing |opponent's )?(?:exerted )?(character|item|location|character or item|character, item or location)(?: with (?:cost )?\d+ (?:¤|⬡|⛉| )?or (?:less|more))? to (its|their|the) player's hand/gi
abilities.explanation: Returns an opponent's card from the board to their hand.
abilities.justification: A tempo-positive play that removes a threat from the board.

abilities.name: Add to Inkwell: Opposing Character
abilities.regex: /(put|add|move) chosen (?:opposing |opponent's )?(?:exerted )?(character|item|location|character or item|character, item or location)(?: with \d+ (?:¤|⬡|⛉) or (?:less|more))? into (its|their|the) player's inkwell/gi
abilities.explanation: Moves an opponent's card from the board into their inkwell.
abilities.justification: A powerful form of removal that also ramps the opponent.

resource_dominance.explanation: Opposite of putting a card into your inkwell as it ramps the opponent

abilities.name: Banish: Chosen Target
abilities.regex: /banish chosen (?:opposing |opponent's )?(damaged )?(character(?:s)?|item|location|character or item|character, item or location)(?! of yours)?(?: with \d+ (?:¤|⬡|⛉) or (?:less|more))?/gi
abilities.explanation: Permanently removes a chosen opponent's card from play.
abilities.justification: The most definitive form of single-target removal.

board_control.explanation: Banish Other Characters, Items or Locations

abilities.name: Banish: All Characters
abilities.regex: /(Banish|put) all (opposing )?(ready |damaged )?characters(?: with (?:cost)? ?(\d+) (?:¤|⬡|⛉)? ?or (?:less|more))? ?(?:on (bottom) of (?:their|their opponent's|their players') decks?)?/gi
abilities.explanation: Permanently removes all characters from the board. Can have other variations.
abilities.justification: The most powerful board control effect, resetting the board state.

board_control.explanation: Banish All - Best in the game

abilities.name: Banish: Opponent's Choice
abilities.regex: /(?:An|Each) opponent chooses and banishes (one|a|an|\d+) of their (characters?|items?|locations?)/gi
abilities.explanation: The opponent chooses one of their own characters to banish.
abilities.justification: Powerful removal, but weaker than choosing the target yourself.

abilities.name: Banish: As a Cost/Choice
abilities.explanation: The player may choose to banish one of their own characters to trigger an effect.
abilities.justification: The cost of banishing a character on your board.

board_control.explanation: This negative value will be offset by the upside of a depending ability on this card

abilities.name: Damage: Deal to One
abilities.regex: /(Deal|move)(?: up to)? (\d+)? ?damage(?: counters?)?(?: from (this|chosen|another|another chosen)?(?: character| location| character or location)?(?: of yours)?)? to (?:chosen|another|another chosen) ?(damaged)? ?(?:opposing )?(?:character|location|character or location)(?! of yours)(?: with \d+ (?:¤|⬡|⛉) or (?:less|more))?/gi
abilities.explanation: Deals a specified amount of damage to a single opposing card.
abilities.justification: A flexible form of removal that can banish weakened cards.

abilities.name: Damage: Put Damage Counters
abilities.explanation: Places a number of damage counters on a character.
abilities.justification: Similar to dealing damage, this can remove or weaken characters.

abilities.name: Damage: Deal to Many
abilities.explanation: Deals or moves damage to all opposing characters or locations.
abilities.justification: An area-of-effect (AoE) ability that can control wide boards.

abilities.name: Damage: Deal Divided
abilities.regex: /(Deal|move) (\d+) damage divided as you choose among any number of chosen opposing characters/gi
abilities.explanation: Deals a total amount of damage that can be split among multiple targets.
abilities.justification: A very flexible form of removal.

abilities.name: Damage: Heal
abilities.regex: /Remove(?: up to)? ?(\d+) damage from (?:chosen|each of your|one of your|any number of chosen)? ?(\w+)? ?(?:characters?|locations?)/gi
abilities.explanation: Removes damage from one of your cards, increasing its survivability.
abilities.justification: Increases the longevity of your characters.

abilities.name: Damage: Deal to Self
abilities.regex: (?:Deal|move)(?: up to)? (\d+)?(:? )?damage( counters)?( from (chosen|another|another chosen)?( character| location| character or location)?( of yours)?)? to (chosen|another|another chosen)? ?(?:opposing )?(character|location|character or location)? ?(of yours|this character)
abilities.explanation: One of your own cards takes damage, usually as a cost or effect.
abilities.justification: Has potential to remove one of your characters.

abilities.name: State: Ready Character
abilities.explanation: Readies one of your exerted characters.
abilities.justification: Enables action advantage.

abilities.name: State: Exert Character
abilities.explanation: Significant tempo advantage gained by neutralizing a character for a turn, preventing questing, challenging, or singing. And leaving him open to challenges.
abilities.justification: Tempo advantage gained by neutralizing a character for a turn, Leaving him open to challenges.

abilities.name: State: Prevent Readying
abilities.regex: /(chosen (?:opposing )|this|your|they) ?characters? can't ready ?(?:at the start of (?:their|your) next turn)?/gi
abilities.explanation: Prevents an opponent's character from readying.
abilities.justification: A stronger form of soft removal.

board_control.explanation: Affects Tempo (negatively if it's own characters)

abilities.name: Movement: To Location
abilities.regex: /move (?:one of )?your characters to a location for free/gi
abilities.explanation: Allows a character to move to a location without paying the move cost.
abilities.justification: Provides tempo and action efficiency.

abilities.name: Stat: Strength Buff
abilities.explanation: Increases the Strength of one or more characters.
abilities.justification: Makes characters better in challenges.

abilities.name: Stat: Strength Debuff
abilities.explanation: Decreases the Strength of one or more characters.
abilities.justification: Makes opposing characters weaker in challenges.

abilities.name: Stat: Willpower Buff
abilities.explanation: Increases the Willpower of one or more characters.
abilities.justification: Increases survivability against damage.

abilities.name: Stat: Cost Reduction
abilities.explanation: Reduces the ink cost to play certain cards.
abilities.justification: A form of resource advantage.

abilities.name: Play: From Discard
abilities.regex: /You may play a (character|item|action|song) card(?: with (?:cost)? ?(\d+) (?:¤|⬡|⛉)? ?or (?:less|more))? from your discard/gi
abilities.explanation: Allows the player to play a card directly from their discard pile.
abilities.justification: A powerful form of card advantage.

abilities.name: Play: For Free
abilities.regex: /(?:You may)? (?:play|reveal) (a|this|an) (character|item|location|action|song|card)(?: card)? (?:with cost (\d+) or less )?(?:for free|and play it for free)/gi
abilities.explanation: Allows the player to play a card without paying its ink cost.
abilities.justification: A massive tempo and resource advantage.

abilities.name: Trigger: On Play
abilities.explanation: This ability triggers when the card itself is played.
abilities.justification: Trigger: On Play -> Best as it's guaranteed and immediate effect

abilities.name: Trigger: On Quest
abilities.explanation: This ability triggers whenever this character quests.
abilities.justification: Trigger: On Quest -> Provides value for performing the primary lore-gaining action. But it has to survive

abilities.name: Trigger: On Banish (Self)
abilities.regex: /When(?:ever)? (this character|he|she|it) is banished(?! in a challenge)/gi
abilities.explanation: This ability triggers when this character is banished.
abilities.justification: Trigger: On Banish (Self) -> Better than Quest but worst than On Play or Leaves Play triggers

abilities.name: Keyword: Evasive
abilities.explanation: This character can only be challenged by other characters with Evasive.
abilities.justification: Evasive provides significant protection from challenges.

lore_velocity.explanation: Can evade any non-Evasive characters to quest freely

abilities.name: Keyword: Rush
abilities.explanation: Allows a character to challenge the turn it is played.
abilities.justification: Rush provides immediate board impact.

abilities.name: Keyword: Ward
abilities.explanation: Opponents can't choose this character except to challenge.
abilities.justification: Ward provides protection from targeted abilities.

abilities.name: Keyword: Resist
abilities.explanation: Reduces damage taken by this character by a specified amount.
abilities.justification: Increases survivability against damage. As well as improving Board Control

abilities.name: Keyword: Singer
abilities.explanation: This character can exert to sing a song of a certain cost or less for free.
abilities.justification: A form of resource ramp for playing song cards.

abilities.name: Play: Song
abilities.regex: /A character with cost (\d+) or more can ⟳ to sing this song for free/gi
abilities.explanation: The reminder text for songs, indicating they can be played for free by exerting a character of sufficient cost.
abilities.justification: This is the core mechanic of song cards, providing resource advantage.
